item.title: Cost Formulas and Break-Even Points for Vibe Coding
item.description:
AI coding tools can be categorized into three billing models:

  1. Per-token billing: Includes various APIs, Claude Code (Claude Pro), Codex Cli (ChatGPT Plus), Zhipu Lite/Pro, Cursor (new version), etc. These are fundamentally token-based, with some products offering package discounts.
  2. Per-API call billing: Such as OpenRouter (free quota), ModelScope, Gemini Code Assistant (1,000 free calls per day), Chutes, etc.
  3. Per-prompt billing: Such as Cursor (legacy version, 500 prompts), Github Copilot (300 prompts), etc.

These three models are essentially paying for model inference and context processing, differing only in pricing granularity and quota forms.
